p: Safe practice should therefore mandate all ophthalmic staff wearing FFP3 respirators when dealing with symptomatic patients, and appropriately wear surgical fluid repellent masks when assessing asymptomatic patients during the COVID-19 pandemic. It should also be standard to source control by offering all patients entering the department with a surgical mask to reduce spread. These aforementioned protocols for respiratory protection were proposed by researchers from University of Hong Kong as lessons learnt from the first SARS outbreak in 2003 [ 13] and they can be adopted in the current COVID 19 pandemic whilst we await robust scientific evidence.
